intro: Dunbaria discolor, commonly known as the white spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white, waxy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring succulent leaves that store water. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Dunbaria discolor is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
